definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Keep your body in a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 保持你的身体在一个中立的立场。

sentences.english: Running shoe built for the neutral to under-pronator who requires an enhanced cushioning.
sentences.chinese: 跑鞋建中立副旋者需要增加缓冲。

sentences.english: Internal walls are lined with wood panelling that forms a warm, neutral backdrop to the space.
sentences.chinese: 建筑内墙采用木质镶嵌版营造出一个温暖中立的空间。

sentences.english: Neutralism is the cornerstone of neutralism foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 中立主义是缅甸外交政策的基石。

sentences.english: Select colors that match or go with neutrals that fit and style .
sentences.chinese: 选择匹配的颜色，或到与中立国适合和作风。

sentences.english: This means knowing the existing constellation of allies, opponents and fence-sitters.
sentences.chinese: 这就意味着要分清敌我以及中立者。

sentences.english: Using gravity and carbon, we could theoretically synthesize fossil fuels.
sentences.chinese: 使用中立和碳，理论上我们能够合成化石燃料。

sentences.english: They thrust a neutral state into war.
sentences.chinese: 他们强把中立国推入战争。

sentences.english: The problem of feedback stabilization for a class of neutral systems with computible delay is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究一类时滞可公度的中立型系统的反馈镇定。

sentences.english: The neutral mask provoked little reaction.
sentences.chinese: 戴中立派面具的人则没有引发任何过激反应。

sentences.english: During the war the organization changed its policy of remaining neutral.
sentences.chinese: 大战期间，该组织改变了它保持中立的政策。

sentences.english: Li Nianguo, my good friend, is in the middle.
A policy of neutrality or nonalignment in international affairs.
sentences.chinese: 国际事务中保持中立或不结盟的政策。

sentences.english: All rudders cause drag, both when steering the boat and in the "neutral" position.
sentences.chinese: 所有舵造成拖累，既当督导船并在“中立”立场。

sentences.english: But as an extra condition, Austria firmly established a permanent neutrality foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 但作为一种附加条件，奥地利确立了永久中立政策。

sentences.english: Second, to pay more attention to the neutrality of the adjudicatory agency.
sentences.chinese: 二是要在救济制度的规则方面强调裁判机构的中立性。

definition: both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
group of people/camp/faction/sides in a dispute
to go to war/to engage in war
